body.name: Seas of Flame: A WWII Submarine Adventure Novel (USS Bull Shark Naval Thriller series Book 6)
body.description: When the hunter becomes the hunted, there is only one choice: turn and fight or run and die…After sinking what the Japanese are calling a battle cruiser, Anvil Art turner and USS Bull shark enjoy a foreshortened leave in Brisbane, Australia. But rear-Admiral Charlie Lockwood needs Turner and his boat back in the fight… so what else is new?After a series of failed assaults on Guadalcanal and Henderson Field, Japan is rallying for a major offensive. Ground troops, surface bombardment and a carrier-supported invasion of the island looms darkly on the horizon. Now Bull Shark must circle the nearby islands to discover and hopefully slow down this onslaught long enough for Allied forces to dig in…On the other side of the world, newly promoted skipper Pat Jarvis is ordered to once more take the new USS Barb out on a recon mission to Africa. He’s to scope the landing zones for Operation Torch. His intelligence will help Allied forces choose the best places to land their troops, tanks and equipment for a major push into Nazi-held territory.Yet along the shores of Europe and in the Mediterranean, danger lurks. Tenacious Nazi destroyers and U-boats hungry for American blood stand between Jarvis and victory!In this latest WWII Naval thriller, two submarines and their crews must struggle against mounting odds and do their part to win the war – torpedoes scream, deck guns thunder and the oceans burn as the world plunges further into a global conflagration like nothing mankind has ever seen!

productInformation.value: #21,326 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #84 in Sea Adventures Fiction (Kindle Store) #126 in War & Military Action Fiction (Kindle Store) #146 in Historical World War II Fiction

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Lot of really good plot twists and turn in each chapter. Great naval yarn with fictional and historical characters intertwined.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Heavy research. Colorful representation. Real characters and escapades with a growing sense of family. Book 5 or 6 and loving every moment. Will miss the characters when the series ends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Another example of "Yankee Ingenuity" at its finest. Love the intro of a new character and see to his development beyond just a side note.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Wonderful book. Makes you feel like you are there taking part in the operation. Can't recommend this book enough. Keep writing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Well written military fiction / history. This excellent series follows the flow of WW2 in both the Pacific and Atlantic. Great character development and exciting action.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I do like to read naval action!
reviews.reviewText: This is the sixth book and has both Atlantic and Pacific action as well as both allies and enemy personnel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Seas of Flame: A action packed WWII submarine novel.
reviews.reviewText: This novel had plenty of action with one submarine and her famous Captain Turner fighting the Japanese in the Pacific to a new Captain Pat Jarvis on a new submarine in the Mediterranean gathering intelligence for the invasion of Africa.Plenty of action from both locations.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These get better and better. It's nice to know there's at least one more and then the spin offs. WW2 submarine warfare. Written good enough that you can get totally into it. Read the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Yet Another Corker of a Yarn!
reviews.reviewText: Have followed Bull Shark through all its trials and tribulations and find it difficult to put the books down. With the insights to their personalities, I feel I know the characters personally now and can't wait for their next adventure. Detail to the actions are fantastic and spellbinding.
In a word excellent, it is impossible to put down. I recommend the series to all adventure buffs. A great series, looking forward to the next adventure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A great book is it fact or fiction ! It is difficult to tell so well written you can drift between without being aware of it.
